page.title: 14Homelife
page.content: The main noticeable change in home life over the past 20 years is that both husband and wife now go out to work when work is available. This places far more responsibility on the children in the home. In our survey it was found that 30% of parents had left home for work before the children in the morning and 20% of the children went home to an empty house or to neighbours in the evening. Traditional eating habits are still maintained i.e. good breakfast, packed lunch for all the family, dinner at night. Convenience foods are now widely used and well liked by the children. Every home has a television and half have access to a video recorder. In lots of homes continental quilts have replaced sheets and blankets. Most homes now have an automatic washing machine, fridge & freezer, 25% have a microwave
